3rd Party Scripting is Moving to UXP.details:
Before you go any further, though, know that Adobe is moving away from Extendscript, and to UXP - Unified Extensibility Platform. Have a look at the API Documentation, and sample plugins

Although Extendscript will be supported at least through the end of 2025, no updates will be made to the API.

Navigating the Guide.details: If you're not sure where to start, take a look at the Overview for how scripting works in Premiere Pro, or the Changelog for updates to the scripting API over time.

Contribution.details:
This endeavour is primarily community-supported & run; contributors are welcome and encouraged to suggest fixes, adjustments, notes/warnings, and anything else that may help the project.

For specific information on how to contribute & best practices, see the Documentation Contribution Guide.

Application object.description:
Provides access to objects and application settings within Premiere Pro.

The single global object is always available by its name, app.

app.anywhere.description: An Anywhere object, providing access to available Anywhere servers. Only available when running in Anywhere configuration (discontinued).

app.build.description: The number of the build of Premiere Pro being run.
app.build.example:
Get a build version of current application.

// in Adobe Premiere Pro version 14.3.1 (Build 45)...
parseInt(app.build); // 45

app.encoder.description:
Provides access to Adobe Media Encoder (on the same system).

Warning

app.encoder is broken on Premiere Pro 14.3.1 - 15 on Mac only. Fixed in 22 and up. See this discussion.

app.getAppPrefPath.description: The path containing the currently active "Adobe Premiere Pro Prefs" file.
app.getAppPrefPath.example:
Get a path to a currently active preference file

app.getAppPrefPath;
// /Users/USERNAME/Documents/Adobe/Premiere Pro/14.0/Profile-USERNAME/

app.getAppSystemPrefPath.description: Premiere Pro's active configuration files, not specific to a given user.
app.getAppSystemPrefPath.example:
Get a path to a currently active configuration folder

app.getAppSystemPrefPath;
// /Library/Application Support/Adobe/Adobe Premiere Pro 2020/

app.getPProPrefPath.description: The path containing the currently active "Adobe Premiere Pro Prefs" file.
app.getPProPrefPath.example:
Get a path to a currently active preference file

app.getPProPrefPath;
// /Users/USERNAME/Documents/Adobe/Premiere Pro/14.0/Profile-USERNAME/

app.getPProSystemPrefPath.description: Premiere Pro's active configuration files, not specific to a given user.
app.getPProSystemPrefPath.example:
Get a path to a currently active configuration folder

app.getPProSystemPrefPath;
// /Library/Application Support/Adobe/Adobe Premiere Pro 2020/

app.learnPanelContentDirPath.description: Get the Learn panel's contents directory path.
app.learnPanelContentDirPath.example:
Get a path to a Learn panel's directory

app.learnPanelContentDirPath;
// /Users/Shared/Adobe/Premiere Pro 2020/Learn Panel/

app.learnPanelExampleProjectDirPath.description: Get the Learn panel's example projects directory path.
app.learnPanelExampleProjectDirPath.example:
Get a path to a Learn panel's example projects' directory

app.learnPanelExampleProjectDirPath;
// /Users/Shared/Adobe/Premiere Pro/14.0/Tutorial/Going Home project/

app.path.description: Get a path to applications executable file.
app.path.example:
Get a path to applications executable file.

app.path;
// /Applications/Adobe Premiere Pro 2020/Adobe Premiere Pro 2020.app/

app.production.type: Production object if at least 1 production is open, null otherwise.

app.projectManager.description: Provides access to project management functions within Premiere Pro.

app.projects.description: An array referencing all open projects; numProjects contains size.

app.properties.description: The properties object provides methods to access and modify preference values.

app.userGuid.description: A unique identifier for the currently logged-in Creative Cloud user.

app.version.description: The version of Premiere Pro, providing the API.
app.version.example:
Get a version of a current application (Adobe Premiere Pro version 14.3.1 (Build 45))

app.version; // 14.3.1

app.getEnableProxies().description: Determines whether proxy usage is currently enabled.
app.getEnableProxies().returns: Returns 1 if proxies are enabled, 0 if they are not.

app.getWorkspaces().description: Obtains an array of available workspaces as Strings.
app.getWorkspaces().example:
Get a list of available workspaces.

app.getWorkspaces();
/* [
    "All Panels",
    "Assembly",
    "Audio",
    "Color",
    "Editing",
    "Effects",
    "Graphics",
    "Learning",
    "Libraries",
    "Metalogging",
    "Production"
]; */
app.getWorkspaces().returns: Array of strings if successful, null if unsuccessful.

app.isDocument().parameters: Parameter Type Description path String A path to a file.
app.isDocument().description: Determines whether the file at path can be opened as a Premiere Pro project.
app.isDocument().example:
Test for valid project files

app.isDocument('~/Desktop/myProject.prproj'); // true
app.isDocument('~/Desktop/textFile.txt');     // false
app.isDocument('~/Desktop/footageFile.mov');  // false
app.isDocument('~/Desktop/imageFile.mov');    // false
app.isDocument().returns: Returns true if file can be opened as a Premiere Pro project.

app.isDocumentOpen().description: Determines whether there are any projects currently open.
app.isDocumentOpen().returns: Returns true if at least 1 project is open; otherwise false.

app.newProject().parameters: Parameter Type Description path String A full path to new project; a .prproj extension will not be added.
app.newProject().description: Creates a new .prproj Project object, at the specified path.

app.openDocument().parameters: Parameter Type Description path String Full path to the document to be opened. suppressConversionDialog Boolean Optional. Suppress project conversion dialog. bypassLocateFileDialog Boolean Optional. Bypass the locate file dialog. bypassWarningDialog Boolean Optional. Bypass warning dialog. doNotAddToMRUList Boolean Optional. Skip adding this file to the Most Recently Used List.
app.openDocument().description: Opens the file at the specified path, as a Premiere Pro Project object.

app.openFCPXML().description: Opens an FCP XML file as a Premiere Pro Project object (specified in projPath).
app.openFCPXML().returns: Returns true if file was successfully opened as a Premiere Pro Project object.

app.quit().description: Quits Premiere Pro; user will be prompted to save any changes to Project object.

app.setEnableProxies().parameters: Parameter Type Description enabled Integer 1 turns proxies on, 0 turns them off.
app.setEnableProxies().description: Determines whether proxy usage is currently enabled.

app.setExtensionPersistent().parameters: Parameter Type Description extensionID String Which extension to modify. persistent Integer Pass 1 to keep extension in memory, 0 to allow unloading.
app.setExtensionPersistent().description: Whether extension with the given extensionID persists, within this session.
app.setExtensionPersistent().example:
var extensionID = 'com.adobe.PProPanel';
// 0 - while testing (to enable rapid reload);
// 1 - for "Never unload me, even when not visible."
var persistent = 0;

app.setExtensionPersistent(extensionID, persistent);

app.setScratchDiskPath().parameters:
Parameter

Type

Description

path

String

The new path to be used.

scratchDiskType

ScratchDiskType enum

Enumerated value, must be one of the following:

  • ScratchDiskType.FirstVideoCaptureFolder
  • ScratchDiskType.FirstAudioCaptureFolder
  • ScratchDiskType.FirstVideoPreviewFolder
  • ScratchDiskType.FirstAudioPreviewFolder
  • ScratchDiskType.FirstAutoSaveFolder
  • ScratchDiskType.FirstCCLibrariesFolder
  • ScratchDiskType.FirstCapsuleMediaFolder
app.setScratchDiskPath().description: Specifies the path to be used for one of Premiere Pro's scratch disk paths.
app.setScratchDiskPath().example:
var scratchPath = Folder.selectDialog('Choose new scratch disk folder');
if (scratchPath && scratchPath.exists) {
    app.setScratchDiskPath(scratchPath.fsName, ScratchDiskType.FirstAutoSaveFolder);
}

app.setSDKEventMessage().description: Writes a string to Premiere Pro's Events panel.

app.setWorkspace().parameters: Parameter Type Description workspace String The name of the workspace.
app.setWorkspace().description: Set workspace as active. Use app.getWorkspaces() to get a list of all available workspaces.
app.setWorkspace().example:
Activate "Editing" workspace.

var workspace = 'Editing';
if (app.setWorkspace(workspace)) {
    alert('Workspace changed to "' + workspace + '"');
} else {
    alert('Could not set "' + workspace + '" workspace');
}

app.trace().description: Writes a string to Premiere Pro's debug console.

app.getProjectViewIDs().description: Returns the view IDs of currently-open views, associated with any project.
app.getProjectViewIDs().example:
var allViewIDs = app.getProjectViewIDs();
if (allViewIDs){
    var firstOne = allViewIDs[0];
} else {
    // No views open.
}
app.getProjectViewIDs().returns: An array of view IDs; can be null.

app.getProjectFromViewID().description: Returns the Project associated with the provided View ID.
app.getProjectFromViewID().example:
var allViewIDs = app.getProjectViewIDs();
if (allViewIDs){
    var firstOne = allViewIDs[0];
    if (firstOne){
        var thisProject = getProjectFromViewID(firstOne);
        if (thisProject){
            var name = thisProject.name;
        } else {
            // no project associated with that view ID.
        }
} else {
    // No views open.
}
app.getProjectFromViewID().returns: A Project object, for the project associated with the provided View ID. Can be null.

app.getCurrentProjectViewSelection().description: Returns an array of ProjectItems selected, in the current active project view.
app.getCurrentProjectViewSelection().example:
var selectedItems = app.getCurrentProjectViewSelection();
if (selectedItems){
    var firstOne = selectedItems[0];
} else {
    // No projectItems selected.
}
app.getCurrentProjectViewSelection().returns: An array of ProjectItems; can be null.

app.broadcastPrefsChanged().parameters: String ID of the preference that changed. (currently only listens to "BE::PreferencesScratchDisksChanged")

Collection object.details: Like an array, a collection associates a set of objects or values as a logical group and provides access to them by index. However, most collection objects are read-only. You do not assign objects to them yourself â€” their contents update automatically as objects are created or deleted.

Objects.methods: Method Return Type Description [] Object Retrieves an object in the collection by its index number. The first object is at index 1.
Objects.attributes: Attribute Type Description length Integer The number of objects in the collection.
Objects.details:
• ComponentCollection object - todo.
  • MarkerCollection object - a collection of the Marker objects in a ProjectItem object and Sequence object.
  • ProjectCollection object - a collection of Project objects.
  • ProjectItemCollection object - a collection of ProjectItem objects.
  • SequenceCollection object - a collection of Sequence objects.
  • TrackCollection object - a collection of Track objects.
  • TrackItemCollection object - a collection of TrackItem objects.

ComponentCollection object.details:
app.project.rootItem.children[index].videoComponents()

app.project.sequences[index].audioTracks[index].clips[index].components

app.project.sequences[index].videoTracks[index].clips[index].components

Info

ComponentCollection is a subclass of Collection object. All methods and attributes of Collection, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with ComponentCollection.

ComponentCollection.numItems.description: The number of items in a ComponentCollection.

MarkerCollection object.details:
app.project.sequences[index].markers

app.project.rootItem.children[index].getMarkers()

The MarkerCollection object represents a collection of Marker objects in a ProjectItem object and Sequence object.

Info

MarkerCollection is a subclass of Collection object. All methods and attributes of Collection, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with MarkerCollection.

MarkerCollection.numMarkers.description: The count of marker objects in the project item or sequence.

MarkerCollection.createMarker().parameters: Parameter Type Description time Float A time, in seconds, where marker should be created.
MarkerCollection.createMarker().description: Create a new Marker object on a project item or a sequence.

MarkerCollection.deleteMarker().parameters: Parameter Type Description marker Marker object A marker object to remove from collection.
MarkerCollection.deleteMarker().description: Remove a given marker object from a collection.

Examples.details:
Remove all markers from the active sequence

var markers = app.project.activeSequence.markers;
var marker = markers.getFirstMarker();
var count = markers.numMarkers;

while (marker) {
    markers.deleteMarker(marker);
    marker = markers.getFirstMarker();
}

alert('Removed ' + count.toString() + ' markers');

MarkerCollection.getFirstMarker().description: Retrieve the first marker object, sorted by time in seconds, on a given project item or sequence.

MarkerCollection.getLastMarker().description: Retrieve the very last marker object, sorted by time in seconds, on a given project item or sequence.

MarkerCollection.getNextMarker().parameters: Parameter Type Description currentMarker Marker object A starting marker object, from which to get a next one.
MarkerCollection.getNextMarker().description: Get the next available marker, sorted by seconds, starting from a given one.

MarkerCollection.getPrevMarker().parameters: Parameter Type Description currentMarker Marker object A starting marker object, from which to get a previous one.
MarkerCollection.getPrevMarker().description: Get the previous available marker, sorted by seconds, starting from a given one.

ProjectCollection object.details:
app.projects

app.production.projects

The ProjectCollection object represents a collection of Project objects.

Info

ProjectCollection is a subclass of Collection object. All methods and attributes of Collection, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with ProjectCollection.

ProjectCollection.numProjects.description: The total number of projects and productions found in the Project panel.

ProjectItemCollection object.details:
app.project.rootItem.children

The ProjectItemCollection object represents a collection of ProjectItem objects in an active project.

Info

ProjectItemCollection is a subclass of Collection object. All methods and attributes of Collection, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with ProjectItemCollection.

ProjectItemCollection.numItems.description: The total number of items in the active project.

SequenceCollection object.details:
app.project.sequences

The SequenceCollection object represents a collection of all the Sequence objects in the active project.

Info

SequenceCollection is a subclass of Collection object. All methods and attributes of Collection, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with SequenceCollection.

SequenceCollection.numSequences.description: The total number of sequences in the active project.

TrackCollection object.details:
app.project.sequences[index].audioTracks

app.project.sequences[index].videoTracks

The TrackCollection object represents a collection of Track objects in a sequence.

Info

TrackCollection is a subclass of Collection object. All methods and attributes of Collection, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with TrackCollection.

TrackCollection.numTracks.description: The total number of tracks in the sequence.

TrackItemCollection object.details:
app.project.sequences[index].audioTracks[index].clips

app.project.sequences[index].videoTracks[index].clips

The TrackItemCollection object represents a collection of TrackItem objects on a track.

Info

TrackItemCollection is a subclass of Collection object. All methods and attributes of Collection, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with TrackItemCollection.

TrackItemCollection.numItems.description: The total number of clips on a track.

Anywhere object.description: The Anywhere object represents any Adobe Anywhere or Team Projects servers available.

Anywhere.getAuthenticationToken().returns: A String containing the login token, or 0 if unsuccessful.

Anywhere.getCurrentEditingSessionActiveS.description: Retrieves the URL of the currently active sequence, within a production.
Anywhere.getCurrentEditingSessionActiveS.returns: Returns a String containing the asset's URL, or 0 if unsuccessful (including if there is no active sequence, or if no editing session is opened).

Anywhere.getCurrentEditingSessionSelecti.description: Retrieves the URL of the currently selected single asset. Will fail if more or fewer than one item is selected.
Anywhere.getCurrentEditingSessionSelecti.returns: Returns a String containing the asset's URL, or 0 if unsuccessful (including if more or fewre than one item is selected).

Anywhere.getCurrentEditingSessionURL().description: Retrieves the URL of the Production, currently being edited.
Anywhere.getCurrentEditingSessionURL().returns: Returns a String containing the production's URL, or 0 if unsuccessful.

Anywhere.isProductionOpen().description: Retrieves whether an Anywhere or Team Projects production is currently open.
Anywhere.isProductionOpen().returns: Returns true if a production is open; false if not.

Anywhere.listProductions().description: Retrieves production names, available to the current user, on the current server.
Anywhere.listProductions().returns: Returns an Array of Strings containing the names of avialable productions, or 0 if unsuccessful.

Anywhere.openProduction().parameters: Parameter Type Description productionURL String The url of the production to open.
Anywhere.openProduction().description: Opens the production at the specified URL.

Anywhere.setAuthenticationToken().parameters: Parameter Type Description token String An authorization token. emailAddress String The associated email address.
Anywhere.setAuthenticationToken().description: Logs the specified email address into the server, using the provided token.

Encoder object.description:
The encoder object represents Adobe Media Encoder, and is used for local rendering, outside of Premiere Pro.

Warning

app.encoder is broken on Premiere Pro 14.3.1 - 15 on Mac only. Fixed in 22 and up. See here.

Encoder.encodeFile().parameters:
Parameter

Type

Description

filePath

String

A path to a file to render.

outputPath

String

A path to an output file.

presetPath

String

A path to a preset (.epr) file.

workArea

Integer

Integer denoting work area to be used:

  • 0 - ENCODE_ENTIRE
  • 1 - ENCODE_IN_TO_OUT
  • 2 - ENCODE_WORK_AREA

removeUponCompletion

Integer

If 1, job will be removed once complete.

inPoint

Time object

A Time object, for the in point of new file.

outPoint

Time object

A Time object, for the out point of new file.
Encoder.encodeFile().description: Makes Adobe Media Encoder render (optionally, a specified range from) the specified file, with the specified settings.
Encoder.encodeFile().returns: Returns a job ID as a String, for the render job added to the AME queue, or 0 if unsuccessful.
Encoder.encodeFile().details: app.encoder.encodeFile(filePath, outputPath, presetPath, workArea, removeUponCompletion, inPoint, outPoint)

Type

Description

ProjectItem object

A project item to render.

outputPath

String

presetPath

String

workArea

Integer denoting work area to be used:

removeUponCompletion

Integer

If 1, job will be removed once complete.
Encoder.encodeProjectItem().description: Makes Adobe Media Encoder render (optionally, a specified range from) the specified ProjectItem object, with the specified settings.
Encoder.encodeProjectItem().returns: Returns a job ID as a String, for the render job added to the AME queue, or 0 if unsuccessful.

Encoder.encodeSequence().parameters:

  • 0 - ENCODE_ENTIRE

Encoder.encodeSequence().description: Makes Adobe Media Encoder render the specified Sequence object, with the specified settings.
Encoder.encodeSequence().returns: Returns a job ID as a String, for the render job added to the AME queue, or 0 if unsuccessful.

Encoder.setEmbeddedXMPEnabled().parameters: Parameter Type Description enabled Integer Pass 1 to enable sidecar output, 0 to disable.
Encoder.setEmbeddedXMPEnabled().description: Determines whether embedded XMP metadata, will be output.
Encoder.setEmbeddedXMPEnabled().returns:
Returns 0 if successful.

Note

Premiere Pro and Adobe Media Encoder will output sidecar XMP for some file formats, and embed XMP for most.

The applications make this determination based on numerous factors, and there is no API control to "force" sidecar or embedded output, for formats which normally use "the other approach".

Encoder.setSidecarXMPEnabled().parameters: Parameter Type Description enabled Integer Pass 1 to enable sidecar output, 0 to disable.
Encoder.setSidecarXMPEnabled().description: Determines whether a sidecar file containing XMP metadata, will be output.

Encoder.startBatch().description: Makes Adobe Media Encoder start rendering its render queue.

Marker object.description: Both Project items and sequences have associated Marker objects, which represent their associated markers.

Marker.end.description: A Time object containing the value of the ending of the marker.

Marker.guid.description: The unique identifier of the marker, created at time of instantiation.

Marker.start.description: A Time object containing the value of the beginning of the marker.

Marker.type.description:
The type of marker, one of:

  • "Comment"
  • "Chapter"
  • "Segmentation"
  • "WebLink"

Note

Premiere Pro can import some marker types which cannot be created from within Premiere Pro.

Marker.getColorByIndex().parameters: Parameter Type Description index Integer Index of the marker to be read.
Marker.getColorByIndex().returns: Returns the color index as an Integer.
Marker.getColorByIndex().details:
app.project.activeSequence.markers.getFirstMarker().getColorByIndex(index)

app.project.rootItem.children[index].getMarkers().getFirstMarker().getColorByIndex(index)

Note

This functionality was added in Adobe Premire Pro 13.x.

Marker.getWebLinkFrameTarget().description: Retrieves the frame target, from the marker's FrameTarget field.
Marker.getWebLinkFrameTarget().returns: Returns a String containing the frame target, or 0 if unsuccessful.

Marker.getWebLinkURL().description: Retrieves the URL, from the marker's URL field.
Marker.getWebLinkURL().returns: Returns a String containing the URL, or 0 if unsuccessful.

Marker.setColorByIndex().parameters: Parameter Type Description colorIndex Integer Index of the color to apply to the marker. markerIndex Integer Index of the marker to be set.
Marker.setColorByIndex().description:
Sets the marker color by index. Color indices listed below.

  • 0 = Green
  • 1 = Red
  • 2 = Purple
  • 3 = Orange
  • 4 = Yellow
  • 5 = White
  • 6 = Blue
  • 7 = Cyan
Marker.setColorByIndex().details:
app.project.activeSequence.markers.getFirstMarker().setColorByIndex(colorIndex, markerIndex)

app.project.rootItem.children[index].getMarkers().getFirstMarker().setColorByIndex(colorIndex, markerIndex)

Note

This functionality was added in Adobe Premire Pro 13.x.

Marker.setTypeAsChapter().description: Sets the type of the marker to "Chapter".

Marker.setTypeAsComment().description: Sets the type of the marker to "Comment".

Marker.setTypeAsSegmentation().description: Sets the type of the marker to "Segmentation".

Marker.setTypeAsWebLink().description: Sets the type of the marker to "WebLink".

Production object.description: The Production object lets ExtendScript access and manipulate productions, insert projects, create new projects and bins, and move existing Production projects to Trash.

Production.projects.description: An array of the projects containined within the Production, which are currently open. Does not include non-open projects.

Production.addProject().parameters: Parameter Type Description srcProjectPath String A path to the source project. destProjectPath String A destination path for added project.
Production.addProject().description: Copies a project from some other location, into the Production directory.

Production.close().description: Closes the Production, and all open projects from within that Production.

Production.getLocked().parameters: Parameter Type Description project Project object The project
Production.getLocked().description: Returns the lock state of a single project within the Production.
Production.getLocked().returns: Returns true if the Project is locked, false if the Project is unlocked.

Production.moveToTrash().parameters: Parameter Type Description projectOrFolderPath String A path to the source project. suppressUI Boolean Whether to suppress any resultant dialogues. saveProject Boolean Whether to save the project(s) first.
Production.moveToTrash().description: Moves the specified path ("bin") or .prproj into the Production's Trash folder.

Production.setLocked().parameters: Parameter Type Description project Project object The project locked Boolean True for locked, false for unlocked.
Production.setLocked().description: Sets the lock state of the specified project within the Production.

Project object.description: Represents a Premiere Pro project. As of Premiere Pro 12.0, multiple projects may be open at the same time.

Project.activeSequence.description: The currently active Sequence object, within the project.
Project.activeSequence.type: A Sequence object, or 0 if no sequence is currently active.

Project.documentID.description: A unique identifier for this project, in format of xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx.

Project.isCloudProject.description: Check whether the project is cloud project.

Project.path.example:
Get a path of a curently active project

app.project.path; // /Users/USERNAME/Desktop/Project.prproj

Project.rootItem.description: A ProjectItem object representing the "root" of the project.
Project.rootItem.type: A ProjectItem object; this will always be of type ProjectItemType_BIN.

Project.addPropertyToProjectMetadataSche.parameters:
Parameter

Type

Description

propertyName

String

A name of property to be added.

propertyLabel

String

A label of property to be added.

propertyType

Integer

Must be one of the following:

  • 0 - Integer
  • 1 - Real
  • 2 - String
  • 3 - Boolean
Project.addPropertyToProjectMetadataSche.description: Adds a new field of the specified type to Premiere Pro's private project metadata schema.

Project.closeDocument().parameters: Parameter Type Description saveFirst Integer If 1, the project will be saved before closing. promptIfDirty Integer If 1, the user will be asked whether they want to save changes first.

Project.consolidateDuplicates().description: Invokes Premiere Pro's "Consolidate Duplicate Footage" functionality, as available from the UI.

Project.createNewSequence().parameters: Parameter Type Description sequenceName String A name of a sequence. sequenceID String An uniquely identifying ID for a new sequence.
Project.createNewSequence().description: Creates a new Sequence object with the specified ID.
Project.createNewSequence().returns: Returns a Sequence object if creation was successful, or 0 if unsuccessful.

Project.createNewSequenceFromClips().parameters: Parameter Type Description sequenceName String Optional. A name for a new sequence. arrayOfProjectItems Array of ProjectItem objects An array of project items to be inserted into sequence. destinationBin ProjectItem object Optional. A bin to contain sequence.
Project.createNewSequenceFromClips().description: Creates a new Sequence object with the given name, in the specified destination bin, and sequentially inserts project items into it.
Project.createNewSequenceFromClips().returns: Returns the newly-created Sequence object if successful; 0 if unsuccessful.

Project.deleteSequence().parameters: Parameter Type Description sequence Sequence object A sequence to delete.
Project.deleteSequence().description: Deletes the specified Sequence object from the project.

Project.exportAAF().parameters: Parameter Type Description sequenceToExport Sequence object A sequence to export. outputPath String An output path for .aaf file. mixdownVideo Integer If 1, render video before export. explodeToMono Integer If 1, breaks out stereo tracks to mono. sampleRate Integer The sample rate of output audio. bitsPerSample Integer The bits per sample of audio output. embedAudio Integer If 1, audio is embedded, if 0, external. audioFileFormat Integer 0 is AIFF, 1 is WAV. trimSources Integer If 1, trim and re-encode media before export; 0 exports the entire file. handleFrames Integer The number of handle frames (from 0 to 1000). presetPath String A path to export preset (.epr) file. renderAudioEffects Integer If 1, render audio effects before export. includeClipCopies Integer If 1, include each copy of a clip. preserveParentFolder Integer If 1, preserves the parent folder, in output.
Project.exportAAF().description: Exports an AAF file of the specified Sequence object, using the specified settings.
Project.exportAAF().details: app.project.exportAAF(sequenceToExport, outputPath, mixdownVideo, explodeToMono, sampleRate, bitsPerSample, embedAudio, audioFileFormat, trimSources, handleFrames, presetPath, renderAudioEffects, includeClipCopies, preserveParentFolder)

Project.exportFinalCutProXML().parameters: Parameter Type Description outputPath String An output path for .xml file. suppressUI Integer If 1, no warnings or alerts will be shown, during the export.
Project.exportFinalCutProXML().description: Exports an FCP XML representation of the entire project, to the specified output path.

Project.exportOMF().parameters: Parameter Type Description sequence Sequence object The sequence to be output. filePath String An output path for .omf file. omfTitle String The title of the OMF. sampleRate The sample rate of output audio. bitsPerSample The bits per sample of audio output. audioEncapsulated Integer If 1, audio is embedded, if 0, external. audioFileFormat Integer 0 is AIFF, 1 is WAV. trimAudioFiles Integer 1 means yes, trim audio files. handleFrames Integer Number of handle frames (from 0 to 1000). includePan Integer 1 means include pan info; 0 means don't.
Project.exportOMF().description: Exports an OMF file of the specified Sequence object, using the specified settings.
Project.exportOMF().details: app.project.exportOMF(sequence, outputPath, omfTitle, sampleRate, bitsPerSample, audioEncapsulated, audioFileFormat, trimAudioFiles, handleFrames, includePan)

Project.exportTimeline().parameters: Parameter Type Description exportControllerName String The name of the Export Controller plug-in to be used. To use the Premiere Pro SDK example Export Controller, the value would be "SDK Export Controller".
Project.exportTimeline().description: Exports the currently active Sequence object, using an Export Controller plug-in with the specified name.
Project.exportTimeline().returns: Returns 0 if successful, or an error code if not.

Project.getGraphicsWhiteLuminance().description: Retrieves the current graphics white luminance value, for this project.
Project.getGraphicsWhiteLuminance().returns: Returns the currently selected graphics white value.

ProjectManager object.description: The ProjectManager object exposes Premiere Pro's Project Manager, for project consolidation, transfer and transcoding.

ProjectManager.affectedSequences.description: An Array of Sequence objects, to be exported.

ProjectManager.clipTranscoderOption.description:
The specified setting for clip transcode. Value will be one of the following:

  • CLIP_TRANSCODE_MATCH_PRESET - Transcode using the specified preset.
  • CLIP_TRANSCODE_MATCH_CLIPS - Match the clips
  • CLIP_TRANSCODE_MATCH_SEQUENCE - Match the sequence

ProjectManager.clipTransferOption.description:
The specified setting for clip transfer. Value will be one of the following:

  • CLIP_TRANSFER_COPY - Copy entire source media.
  • CLIP_TRANSFER_TRANSCODE - Transcode to default output format.

ProjectManager.convertAECompsToClips.description: If true, render dynamically-linked After Effects compositions to new media (using specified output preset).

ProjectManager.convertImageSequencesToCl.description: If true, transcode image sequences to new media (using specified output preset).

ProjectManager.convertSyntheticsToClips.description: If true, transcode clips from synthetic importers to new media (using specified output preset).

ProjectManager.copyToPreventAlphaLoss.description: If true, includes any available alpha information into transcoded media.

ProjectManager.destinationPath.description: The path to which to export the project and media.

ProjectManager.encoderPresetFilePath.description: The path to the output preset (.epr file) to be used.

ProjectManager.excludeUnused.description: If non-zero, exclude unused project items from the exported project.

ProjectManager.handleFrameCount.description: How many frames of 'handle' footage (before and after the in and out points) of media, to include.

ProjectManager.includeAllSequences.description: If true, export all Sequences in the exported project.

ProjectManager.includeConformedAudio.description: If true, include conformed audio files with exported project.

ProjectManager.includePreviews.description: If true, include rendered preview files with exported project.

ProjectManager.renameMedia.description: If true, perform renaming as part of the export process.

Properties.doesPropertyExist().parameters: Parameter Type Description property String A property to check
Properties.doesPropertyExist().description: Checks whether a given property exists in preferences.
Properties.doesPropertyExist().example:
Check whether labels with indices 10 and 99 exist in preferences:

var property = 'BE.Prefs.LabelNames.10';
var exists = app.properties.doesPropertyExist(property);
alert('Property "' + property + '" exists: ' + exists.toString());

property = 'BE.Prefs.LabelNames.99';
exists = app.properties.doesPropertyExist(property);
alert('Property "' + property + '" exists: ' + exists.toString());

Properties.getProperty().parameters: Parameter Type Description property String A property to get a value for
Properties.getProperty().example:
Get label name at a given index:

var labelIndex = 0;
var property = 'BE.Prefs.LabelNames.' + labelIndex;

if (app.properties.doesPropertyExist(property)) {
    alert(app.properties.getProperty(property));
} else {
    alert('Property "' + property + '" does not exist');
}

Properties.isPropertyReadOnly().parameters: Parameter Type Description property String A property to check.
Properties.isPropertyReadOnly().description: Checks whether a given property can be overwritten by the user. Returns false if such property does not exist.

Properties.setProperty().parameters: Parameter Type Description property String A property to create value Any A value for a property persistent Boolean Whether if should be persistent between sessions createIfNotExist Boolean Should create, if such property does not exist
Properties.setProperty().description:
Set property value.

Note

For any file paths to be used in Premiere Pro's preferences, a trailing path seperator is mandatory.
Properties.setProperty().example:
Change label name:

var labelIndex = 0;
var property = 'BE.Prefs.LabelNamesX.' + labelIndex;

var newValue = 'Changed via Script';
var persistent = true;
var createIfNotExist = true;

if (app.properties.doesPropertyExist(property)) {
    if (app.properties.isPropertyReadOnly(property)) {
        alert('Could not rename property "' + property + '" because it is read-only.');
    } else {
        var oldValue = app.properties.getProperty(property);
        app.properties.setProperty(property, newValue, persistent, createIfNotExist);
        alert('Value changed from "' + oldValue + '" to "' + newValue + '"');
    }
} else {
    app.properties.setProperty(property, newValue, persistent, createIfNotExist);
    alert('Created new property "' + property + '" with value "' + newValue + '"');
}

Adobe Premiere Pro 23.0.details:
Warning

Decision: No further changes or improvements to Premiere Pro's ExtendScript API are planned or scheduled. Any such changes will be reconsidered, once Premiere Pro moves to UXP-based extensibility.

Adobe Premiere Pro 15.4.details:
• Access to the currently active project selection
    • Added: app.getCurrentProjectViewSelection()
  • New API to move a trackItem.
    • Added: TrackItem.move()
  • New APIs to set the disabled state of a trackItem.
    • Added: TrackItem.disabled

Adobe Premiere Pro 13.x.details:
• Scripting access to Marker colors:
    • Added: Marker.getColorByIndex()
    • Added: Marker.setColorByIndex()

Overview.details:
Premiere Pro provides an ExtendScript API, allowing for the access and manipulation of most project elements, including metadata, exporting and rendering options.

Note

This document does not teach ExtendScript, ExtendScript debugging, or other development techniques. It focuses on the Premiere Pro ExtendScript API and the execution context for scripts.

While initially incomplete and intended only for internal testing, the Premiere Pro ExtendScript API has been growing steadily for many years. As of 12.1.1 (the current release, as of this writing), the API offers thorough access to (and, often, control over) all project elements, as well as application settings.

Example code.details: The PProPanel sample exercises Premiere Pro's ExtendScript API: https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/tree/master/PProPanel.

Development and debugging tools.details:
ExtendScript Toolkit (ESTK) is longer updated by Adobe; the recommended debugging environment for ExtendScript is Microsoft Visual Studio Code, with Adobe's ExtendScript debugging extension:

https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Adobe.extendscript-debug

How to Execute ExtendScript in Premiere.details:
Executing scripts from within CEP panels is the recommended approach.

With additional configuration work, it's also possible to pass scripts to Premiere Pro on a command line. This is not recommended, as behavior varies across platforms, and preliminary configuration is necessary before such execution is enabled.

Use VSCode with Adobe's extension for development and debugging; for deployed workflows, stick with panels whenever possible.

ProjectItem.clearOutPoint().description: Clears any assigned out point; the project item will then start at startTime.

ProjectItem.createBin().parameters: Parameter Type Description name String A name of a new bin.

ProjectItem.createSubClip().parameters: Parameter Type Description name String A name of a new subclip. startTime String Start time of subclip, in ticks. endTime String End time of subclip, in ticks. hasHardBoundaries Integer If 1, the user cannot extend in and out. takeVideo Integer If 1, use video from source. takeAudio Integer If 1, use audio from source.

ProjectItem.deleteBin().description: Deletes a bin and all its contents from the project.

ProjectItem.findItemsMatchingMediaPath().description: Returns an array of project items, all of which reference the same media path.
ProjectItem.findItemsMatchingMediaPath().returns: Returns an array of project items, or 0 if no project items matching the matchPath were found.

ProjectItem.getColorLabel().returns:
Integer, one of:

  • 0 = Violet
  • 1 = Iris
  • 2 = Caribbean
  • 3 = Lavender
  • 4 = Cerulean
  • 5 = Forest
  • 6 = Rose
  • 7 = Mango
  • 8 = Purple
  • 9 = Blue
  • 10 = Teal
  • 11 = Magenta
  • 12 = Tan
  • 13 = Green
  • 14 = Brown
  • 15 = Yellow

ProjectItem.getColorSpace().example:
this will write the above info to the Events panel.

var colorSpace = app.project.rootItem.children[0].getColorSpace()
app.setSDKEventMessage("Color Space " + " = " + colorSpace.name, 'info');
app.setSDKEventMessage("Transfer Characteristic " + " = " + colorSpace.transferCharacteristic, 'info');
app.setSDKEventMessage("Color Primaries " + " = " + colorSpace.primaries, 'info');
app.setSDKEventMessage("Matrix Equation " + " = " + colorSpace.matrixEquation, 'info');
ProjectItem.getColorSpace().returns:
Returns an item's colorspace properties, an object consisting of:

  • name
  • transferCharacteristic
  • primaries
  • matrixEquation

ProjectItem.getOriginalColorSpace().returns:
Returns an item's colorspace properties, an object consisting of:

  • name
  • transferCharacteristic
  • primaries
  • matrixEquation

ProjectItem.getInputLUTID().example:

ProjectItem.getInPoint().description: Obtains the current project item in point.
ProjectItem.getInPoint().returns: A Time object, containing the in point.

ProjectItem.getMarkers().description: Retrieves the MarkerCollection object associated with this project item.

ProjectItem.getMediaPath().description:
Returns the path associated with the project item's media, as a String.

Note

This only works for atomic media; this call cannot provide meaningful paths for media which has no actual path (which will be the case for any media generated by synthetic importers, like Premiere Pro's own Universal Counting Leader).

Also, for image sequences, only the path to the first image in the sequence will be returned.
ProjectItem.getMediaPath().returns: A String containing the path to the media associate with the project item.

ProjectItem.getOutPoint().parameters:
Parameter

Type

Description

mediaType

Integer

Pass 1 for video only, or 2 for audio only.

If no mediaType is passed, function gets the out point for all media.
ProjectItem.getOutPoint().description: Retrieves the current out point for specified media type.

ProjectItem.getProjectMetadata().description: Retrieves metadata associated with the project item. Distinct from media XMP.
ProjectItem.getProjectMetadata().returns: A String containing all Premiere Pro private project metadata, serialized.

ProjectItem.getProjectColumnsMetadata().description: Returns a JSON string to the user with all the metadata from the current project view layout
ProjectItem.getProjectColumnsMetadata().returns:
A JSON string that can be parsed with JSON.parse() method in the Javascript layer.

This generates a list of objects, each object representing a column. Each object will contain 4 key/value pairs: ColumnName, ColumnValue, ColumnID, ColumnPath.

  • ColumnName and ColumnValue serve as informational key/value.
  • ColumnID and ColumnPath can be used to modify that column via the method setProjectMetadata() or setXMPMetadata().

For example:

Key Value Description ColumnName "Name" Name of the column ColumnValue "A014C003_180620_R205.mov" Example of colummn value ColumnID "Column.Intrinsic.Name" ID of the colummn ColumnPath "http://ns.adobe.com/premierePrivateProjectMetaData/1.0/" Path of the column

ProjectItem.getProxyPath().description: Retrieves the path to the proxy media associated with this project item.
ProjectItem.getProxyPath().returns: Returns the path (as String) to the proxy media associated with the proxy item, or 0 if none is found.

ProjectItem.getXMPMetadata().description: Retrieves the XMP metadata associated with the project item, as a String.
ProjectItem.getXMPMetadata().returns: A String containing all XMP metadata, serialized.

ProjectItem.hasProxy().description: Indicates whether a proxy has already been attached, to the project item.
ProjectItem.hasProxy().returns: Returns true if the project item has a proxy attached; false if not.

ProjectItem.isMergedClip().description: Indicates whether the project item refers to a merged clip.

ProjectItem.isMulticamClip().description: Indicates whether the project item refers to a multicam clip.
ProjectItem.isMulticamClip().returns: Returns true if the project item is a multicam clip, false if it isn't.

ProjectItem.isOffline().description: Returns a Boolean indicating whether the project item is offline.

ProjectItem.isSequence().description: Indicates whether the project item refers to a Sequence object.
ProjectItem.isSequence().returns: Returns true if the project item is a Sequence object, or a multicam clip, or a merged clip. Returns false if it isn't any of those.

ProjectItem.refreshMedia().returns: An array of markers associated with the project item, or 0 if there are no markers.

ProjectItem.select().returns: Returns 0 if the project item has successfully been made the target, for subsequent imports.

ProjectItem.startTime().description: Returns a Time object, representing start time.

ProjectItem.videoComponents().description: Video components for the 'Master Clip' of this project item.

TrackItem object.description: The TrackItem object represents an item on a video or audio track, within a Sequence object.

TrackItem.components.description: The components associated with this trackItem. This can include intrinsic transformations, as well as video and audio effects.

TrackItem.end.description:
The visible end time of the trackItem in the sequence, relative to the beginning of its corresponding sequence (NOT the sequence zero point).

Note

This may differ from the trackItem's out point, which is relative to the source.

TrackItem.inPoint.description: The in point set on the source for this trackItem instance, relative to the beginning of the source.

TrackItem.mediaType.description: The mediaType of media provided by this trackItem.

TrackItem.outPoint.description: The out point set on the source for this TrackItem instance, relative to the beginning of the source.

TrackItem.projectItem.description: The ProjectItem object from which the media is being drawn.

TrackItem.start.description: The visible start time of the trackItem in the sequence, relative to the beginning of its corresponding sequence (NOT the sequence zero point). Note: This may differ from the trackItem's in point, which is relative to the source.

TrackItem.type.description: The type of media provided by this trackItem.

TrackItem.getMGTComponent().parameters: Parameter Type Description mogrtPath String Full path to a valid .mogrt, created in After Effects targetTime String The time at which to insert the .mogrt, in ticks vidTrackOffset Integer The offset from 0 (the first available track), on which to insert video from the .mogrt audTrackOffset Integer The offset from 0 (the first available track), on which to insert audio from the .mogrt
TrackItem.getMGTComponent().description: Adds an After Effects Motion Graphics Template - a Mogrt - to the selected track at the specified time.
TrackItem.getMGTComponent().returns: A Component object representing the parameters of the .mogrt, which the creator has exposed.

TrackItem.getSpeed().description: Returns the speed multiplier applied to the TrackItem.
TrackItem.getSpeed().returns: Returns the speed multiplier applied to the TrackItem, as a Float. No speed adjustment = 1.

TrackItem.isAdjustmentLayer().description: Returns wheter the TrackItem is an adjustment layer.
TrackItem.isAdjustmentLayer().returns: Returns true if the trackitem is an adjustment layer; false if not.

TrackItem.isSpeedReversed()mm.returns: Returns 1 if TrackItem is reversed; 0 if not.

TrackItem.isSelected().description: Retrieves the current selection state of the trackItem.
TrackItem.isSelected().returns: Returns true if trackItem is selected; false if not.

TrackItem.setSelected().parameters: Parameter Type Description state Integer If 1, the track item will be selected; if 0, it will be deselected. updateUI Integer If 1, the Premiere Pro UI will be updated after this function call is made.
TrackItem.setSelected().description: Sets the selection state of the trackItem.

TrackItem.getMatchName().description: Retrieves the match name for the trackItem.
TrackItem.getMatchName().returns: Returns the match name as a String if successful.

TrackItem.remove().parameters: Parameter Type Description inRipple Boolean If 1, later track items will be moved earlier, to fill the gap; if 0, later track items will remain in place. inAlignToVideo Boolean If 1, Premiere Pro will align moved track items to the start of the nearest video frame.
TrackItem.remove().description: Sets the selection state of the trackItem.

TrackItem.disabled.parameters: Parameter Type Description newDisableState Boolean If true, this TrackItem will be disabled; if false, TrackItem will be enabled.

Component object.description: The Component object represents something which has been added or applied to a trackItem.

Component.displayName.description: The name of the component, as it is displayed to the user. Localized.

Component.matchName.description: The name of the component, as it is loaded from disk; used to uniquely identify effect plug-ins.

Component.properties.description: The properties of the component in question; typically, these are effect parameters.

ComponentParam object.description:
The ComponentParam object represents a parameter associated with a component, applied to a TrackItem object.

Note

For a developer working across different localizations, it's possible to find the corresponding keys by comparing ZStrings.

Below is an example between En and De. Here are the paths to the files: C:\Program Files\Adobe\Adobe Premiere Pro 2024\Dictionaries\de_DE\zdictionary_PPRO_de_DE.dat - ("â€¦anti-Flimmer Filter") C:\Program Files\Adobe\Adobe Premiere Pro 2024\Dictionaries\en_DE\zdictionary_PPRO_en_US.dat - ("â€¦anti-flicker Filter")

ComponentParam.displayName.description: The name of the component parameter, as it is displayed to the user. Localized.

ComponentParam.addKey().parameters: Parameter Type Description time Time object When the keyframe should be added.
ComponentParam.addKey().description: Adds a keyframe to the component parameter stream, at the specified time. Note: This can only be set on parameters which support keyframing.

ComponentParam.areKeyframesSupported().description: Retrieves whether keyframes are supported, for this component parameter.
ComponentParam.areKeyframesSupported().returns: Returns true if keyframes are supported; false if not.

ComponentParam.findNearestKey().parameters: Parameter Type Description timeToCheck Start search from a given time threshold Integer A temporal distance, in either direction, in ticks.
ComponentParam.findNearestKey().description: Sets whether the component parameter varies, over time. Note: This can only be set on parameters which support keyframing.
ComponentParam.findNearestKey().returns: Returns a Time value, indicating when the closest keyframe is.

ComponentParam.findNextKey().parameters: Parameter Type Description timeToCheck Start search from a given time.
ComponentParam.findNextKey().description: Returns the keyframe temporally subsequent to the provided timeToCheck. Note: This can only be set on parameters which support keyframing.
ComponentParam.findNextKey().returns: Returns a Time value, indicating when the closest keyframe is, or 0 if there is no available subsequent keyframe.

ComponentParam.findPreviousKey().parameters: Parameter Type Description timeToCheck Start search from a given time.
ComponentParam.findPreviousKey().description: Returns the keyframe temporally previous to the provided timeToCheck. Note: This can only be set on parameters which support keyframing.
ComponentParam.findPreviousKey().returns: Returns a Time value, indicating when the closest keyframe is, or 0 if there is no available previous keyframe.

ComponentParam.getColorValue().description: Obtains the value of the component parameter stream. Note: This can only work on parameters which are not time-variant.
ComponentParam.getColorValue().returns: Returns a Color containing the values found in the component parameter stream, or 0 if unsuccessful.

ComponentParam.getKeys().description: Returns an array of all keyframes on the timeToCheck component parameter. Note: This can only be set on parameters which support keyframing.
ComponentParam.getKeys().returns: Returns an array of Time values, indicating at what time each keyframe occurs, or 0 if no keyframes are available.

ComponentParam.getValue().description: Obtains the value of the component parameter stream. Note: This can only work on parameters which are not time-variant.
ComponentParam.getValue().returns: Returns the value of the component parameter stream; the return varies with stream type.

ComponentParam.getValueAtKey().parameters: Parameter Type Description time Time object A time from which the keyframe value should be retrieved.
ComponentParam.getValueAtKey().description: Retrieves the value of the component parameter stream, at the specified keyframe time. Note: Can only be used with keyframeable parameter streams.
ComponentParam.getValueAtKey().returns: Returns the value of the component parameter stream at time, or 0 if unsuccessful.

ComponentParam.getValueAtTime().parameters: Parameter Type Description time Time object A time from which the keyframe value should be retrieved.
ComponentParam.getValueAtTime().description: Retrieves the value of the component parameter stream, at the specified time. If the value is between two keyframes then interpolation takes place.
ComponentParam.getValueAtTime().returns: Returns the value of the component parameter stream at time, or 0 if unsuccessful.

ComponentParam.isTimeVarying().description: Retrieves whether the component parameter varies, over time.
ComponentParam.isTimeVarying().returns: Returns true if the parameter varies over time; false if not.

ComponentParam.removeKey().parameters: Parameter Type Description time Time object A time value, indicating when the keyframe should be removed.
ComponentParam.removeKey().description: Removes a keyframe on the component parameter stream, at the specified time. Note: This can only be set on parameters which support keyframing.

ComponentParam.removeKeyRange().parameters: Parameter Type Description startTime Time object The times (inclusive) to begin the removal of keyframes. endTime Time object The times to end the removal of keyframes.
ComponentParam.removeKeyRange().description: Removes all keyframes from the component parameter stream, between the specified times. Note: This can only be set on parameters which support keyframing.

Sequence.attachCustomProperty().description: Attaches a custom property, and its value, to the sequence. This property is visible if/when the sequence is exported to FCP XML.

Sequence.autoReframeSequence().parameters:
Parameter

Type

Description

numerator

Integer

Numerator of desired frame aspect ratio.

denominator

Integer

Denominator of desired frame aspect ratio.

motionPreset

String

One of:

  • slower
  • default
  • faster

newName

String

A name for a newly created sequence.

useNestedSequences

Boolean

Whether to honor nested sequence.
Sequence.autoReframeSequence().example:
var sequence = app.project.activeSequence;
if (sequence) {
    var numerator = 1;
    var denominator = 1;
    var motionPreset = 'default'; // 'default', 'faster', 'slower'
    var newName = sequence.name + ', auto-reframed.';
    var useNestedSequences  = false;

    var newSequence = sequence.autoReframeSequence(numerator, denominator, motionPreset, newName, useNestedSequences);

    if (newSequence) {
        alert('Created reframed sequence: ' + newName + '.');
    } else {
        alert('Failed to create re-framed sequence: ' + newName + '.');
    }
} else {
    alert('No active sequence');
}

Sequence.createSubsequence().parameters: Parameter Type Description ignoreTrackTargeting Boolean Whether the new sequence should ignore the track targeting, in the original sequence. Optional, default is false
Sequence.createSubsequence().description: Creates a new sequence, from the in point to the out point, which is a sub-sequence of the original sequence.
Sequence.createSubsequence().example:
function nestSelection() {
    var activeSequence = app.project.activeSequence;
    var selection = activeSequence.getSelection();

    if (!selection.length) {
        return;
    }

    var trackId = selection[0].parentTrackIndex;
    var originalInPoint = activeSequence.getInPointAsTime();
    var originalOutPoint = activeSequence.getOutPointAsTime();
    var start = selection[0].start;
    var end = selection[selection.length - 1].end;
    activeSequence.setInPoint(start.seconds);
    activeSequence.setOutPoint(end.seconds);

    var nestedSequence = activeSequence.createSubsequence(true);

    activeSequence.videoTracks[trackId].overwriteClip(nestedSequence.projectItem, start.seconds);
    activeSequence.setInPoint(originalInPoint.seconds);
    activeSequence.setOutPoint(originalOutPoint.seconds);

    return nestedSequence;
}
Sequence.createSubsequence().returns:
Returns the newly-created Sequence object.

Note

This is not the same as nesting. The newly-created sequence is not inserted back into the original sequence. To nest, see the example function below.
